ygData.subject: Questions on ARC file format
ygData.msgSnippet: If I happen to be off topic on this one, please say so, and point me to the right place (list) First question: Can I utilize the usual HTML parsers available

If I happen to be off topic on this one, please say so, and point me
to the right place (list) 

First question: Can I utilize the usual HTML parsers available as Perl
Modules (such as HTML::TreeBuilder and HTML::TokeParser) to work on
the ARC files? If the answer is YES everything is solved and I don't
need answers on the other questions. If the answer is NO (which is
probably the case) then...

Second questions: Do you know any open source utility that can convert
the ARC file into proper HTML? Or even many utilities that can be used
together to achieve this? Or to I need to parse the document myself
using regExps to discard everything ARC-specific from it and thus take
as output an almost-proper HTML?

Third Question: Are there any open source utilities that can parse ARC
files and extract specific stuff from them, such as links, titles of
documents etc?

Note: I'm talking about ARCs that have only text/html in them. My ARCs
are clean of any binary stuff.

I apologize in advance if I am off topic. Please forgive.
I thank you any advance for every useful (or not useful) answers or
points to any documentation or utilities on those matters...
